message: You guys see this?
http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=2177172
yeah, so?
oh dang, I was downvoted, LOL
I'm pretty impressed with jacobian's troll sparring
Haha, yeah, your downvotes...people don't like to hear the truth I guess :P
All the drama aside though, it's a pretty neat app, just monkeypatches the proper methods to use a more secure algorithm.
The Django devs were *super* smart to prefix passwords with the algorithm choice
That's some incredible foresight IMO
yeah, actually, reading that thread shows what's fucked up with the community. and I'm starting to get really tired of hitting that issue again and again.
@jezdez Which one?
Because stevelosh had about ten million complaints
the "OMG DJANGO DOESN'T DO <XYZ>, IT'S FUCKING STUPID AND THE DEVS ARE TOO AND I'M GOING TO JUST MONKEY PATCH THIS SHIT AND BE PROUD OF IT TOO"
seriously, it's tiring
it makes me want to stop working on the project
Yeah, that's very frustrating :(
I called steve multiple times to contribute fixes, he hasn't and always found a reason to not do it
last time it was missing support for pull requests
.. on github
which we do now
sigh
Is that lame? Maybe :P
are the messages google indexed?
gah, I shouldn't bitch in public
Plus Google's too busy indexing content farms than Convore

Plus plus, I can't seem to get Google to index us properly, anyway. http://www.google.com/search?sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8&q=convore+django#hl=en&q=+site:convore.com+convore+django&sa=X&ei=jtRLTcXmEIS8sAPYsK3rCg&ved=0CAIQqAQwAg&fp=6aaff458859385c2
Eventually, hopefully.
didn't do anything else with it :/
night :)
Wow, there's a joke to be made there...I'm gonna pass on it though.
@jezdez Yeah he's really good with the trolls.
Honestly I take him as an example when trying to respond to angry people...it happened today on Convore, and I literally thought about how he would have responded if it were about Django.
oh good god, can I edit messages here?
oh well, you'll get there :)
no
you can delete though
yeah
No worries, this topic will be buried soon I'm sure
oops, safari just crashed
@jezdez Seriously? You think it was Convore?
well, there were other tabs open
so not sure, I'll make sure to save the crash report next time
Thanks @jezdez
And on that note I'm off to bed
night y'all
That thread looks pretty reasonable to me, and the app itself is an excellent contribution to the community, given the dilemmas with bcrypt support in core.

I think the single greatest contribution a core dev of an open source project can make to its community is by responding to critique without getting pissy or defensive, even if it might be "justified".
I don't find critiques of Django tiring. Django's far from perfect, we all know that. Kudos to jacobian for non-defensive responses.
I suppose it's all my fault for being tired of Open Source. Fair enough.
